div.p: Greetings. I have now received your letter written on the 21st of this month along with the discussion of the words of the Lord "In my Father's house" and I am grateful. I have again received letters from the court, in which friends express that what you wrote was most pleasing to them. I believe that in a good and pious cause, the king will not lack friends and that God will be with him.
On the eighth or ninth of April, I will visit you and we will discuss matters in person with several others. The whole family sends their regards to you.
Please convey my greetings to all friends in my name.
